message.content:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: public class SumOfIntegersInString {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        String str = "12 hi when 8 and 9";
        StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(str, " ");
        int sum = 0;
        while (st.hasMoreTokens()) {
            String temp = st.nextToken();
            try {
                sum += Integer.parseInt(temp);
            } catch (NumberFormatException nfe) {
                // Not an integer, ignore
            }
        }
        System.out.println("Sum of integers in string is: " + sum);
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: This program uses the StringTokenizer class to break the input string into tokens using space as a delimiter. It then tries to parse each token as an integer. If the token is an integer, it is added to the sum. If it is not an integer (i.e., it is a word), a NumberFormatException is thrown and caught, and the program simply ignores this token and moves on to the next one. The sum of all integers found in the string is then printed out.
